This country is the lineage of the ancestral dragon.
Now it belongs to the southern barbarians.
To the north, it borders the mixed dwelling of the Qiang people. To the west, beyond this barbarian territory, it enters the southern border of the Tubo Kingdom.
To the west, crossing several layers of high mountains and steep peaks, traversing rivers and valleys, it passes through three or four thousand li, passing through the Tubo border.
Crossing the Himalayas to the south, one reaches the eastern border of India, the country of Kamaluva.
Next, to the south are the countries of Samatata, Harikela, and Tamralipti.
This mountain route is very close to India.
But it is dangerous and difficult to travel.
This is the shortest land route between the Tang Dynasty and the Five Indias.
However, in the hot and humid summer months, poisonous insects make it impossible to travel. Those who encounter them find it difficult to survive.
In autumn, there are many storms and floods, making it impossible to travel.
In winter, although there are no poisons, the accumulated snow and freezing cold make it difficult to climb.
Only in the second and third months of spring is it possible to pass through.
One must also understand several barbarian languages, carry goods to buy the way, rely on local guides, and ask for directions along the way in order to reach there.
The mountain is dangerous and has no roads, making it difficult to know whether it is passable or not.
This is said for the benefit of those who wish to seek the Dharma and make pilgrimages in the future, to inform those who have not yet heard of this.
